TypeSignature.Value: .class public auto ansi abstract beforefieldinit ClickedEventArgs extends System.EventArgs
Public MustInherit Class ClickedEventArgs Inherits EventArgs
public ref class ClickedEventArgs abstract : EventArgs

remarks.para: The ClickedEventArgs object passes state information to an event handler for the Clicked event, which is associated with a Button control.

MemberSignature.Value: .method familyhidebysig specialname rtspecialname instance void .ctor() cil managed
Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property ControlId As String
public: abstract property System::String ^ ControlId { System::String ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets the value of ID property for the Button control that raised the event.
Docs.value: The ID of the button control.

example.para: In the following example, the ControlId property is used to display the ID property value (MyButton) for the Button control.
example.code: Public Sub MyButton_Clicked(ByVal sender As Object, _ ByVal e As ClickedEventArgs) MessageBox.Show(e.ControlId) End Sub

MemberSignature.Value: Public MustOverride ReadOnly Property Source As XPathNavigator
public: abstract property System::Xml::XPath::XPathNavigator ^ Source { System::Xml::XPath::XPathNavigator ^ get(); };

Docs.summary: Gets an XPathNavigator object positioned at the innermost XML node of the form's underlying XML document that contains the Button control.
Docs.value: An XPathNavigator object positioned at the innermost XML node of the form's underlying XML document that contains the Button control.

remarks.para: After you have set a reference to the XPathNavigator object that the Source property returns, you can use the properties and methods that are supported by the XPathNavigator class.

example.para: In the following example, the Source property is used to return an XPathNavigator object, which is then used to display the of the innermost XML node of the form's underlying XML document that contains the Button control.
